description:
I love the look and feel.  Unfortunately in practice it's failed me in several occasions.  First it failed to load at times - though to be fair after an update that seems to have finally been addressed.

Currently my biggest issue is that the middle click copy/paste isn't working properly ... sometimes it works, but it seems that if I copy something using Ctrl-C that overrides the middle click.  For sanity's sake I tested this in several other Terminals, including the built-in one - and they work as expected: Ctrl-C/Ctrl-V work, but highlighting and using the middle-click work independent of each other.
I like the ability to resize multiple sessions under one window, it cant properly kill services.
Needs some improvement.
Multiple windows.
Really good terminal. Customizable, divisions, colors, fonts, etc.

Is it possible to have too many options? You can manage your grid of termiinals and their layouts entirely from the keyboard - if you could ever remember all the commands. The plugins are a little sparse right now, but I don't know what else you'd want this thing to do. Highly recommended - beats the hell out of having multiple terminal windows open when compiling and searching for depenencies... it's all right there, an easy copy & paste away. Good stuff.
Works great on CentOS 7 and I recommend it as a replacement to the default GNOME terminal.
This is a great version of the generic terminal 5stars
works get on other PC's just not this one running fedora
summary: Doesn't work on X1 carbon for some reason

description: Incresses multi tasking
using it at all my devices
If you like iTerm on the Mac, you will probably like Terminator.

This is my go to terminal, love the split screen mode, tabs etc.

Simple the best
Love it for it's versatility, makes managing multiple sessions side-by-side r tabbed effortless.
summary: The best terminal emulator out there

description: Simply what I was missing! The only quirk however is with reordering the windows - takes a few drags to get right.
I wanna thank the developers of terminator for developing this. It just does it all , i mean the keyboard shortcuts, the interface and so on.
Use it daily Thanks for this great product.

say I typed a string " echo hello world " on the terminal. 
how do I copy the text into vim file just using shortcuts combination? is it possible, I know xclip but just too many types
summary: Nice but how to copy command without mouse!

description: I use this app 24/7 for script writing. Easy to have one instance running nano and another simply to navigate directories and another for running the script so your terminal doesnt get clogged up in whatever else you are doing. Works smoothly. No issues at all.
Have used terminal emulators for 20 years on Linux, Mac and Windows. Terminator is my choice
summary: There isn't a better terminal on any platform

description: As a server admin by profession, this is the only SSH terminal client that I can actually use and always tend to use when not near me
It's a greate app and also easy to use
summary: It's grate app for a developer

description: This used to be my go-to terminal. It's extremely powerful, but guake has stolen me away. If you spend a lot of time in a terminal, this is a great option and works well, but for the average user it's really overkill and clunky to use.

First, I want to say a whole hearty kudos and thank you to the author and contributors for the efforts that have been put into this app! I love this app!  I'm a web developer and have been using Terminator religiously. I hope one day when I have the discretionary funds to support it, but that is a topic for another time. 

Back to my "review/bug report" - Recently, like with the last week or so, Terminator has stopped working. I see the arrow/cursor spinner like it's trying to load then after about 30-45 seconds it seems to just die. I'm not seeing the process load up in the Ubuntu system process monitor. 

According to the Ubuntu system logs, I'm seeing the following error: 
Syntax Error
Sender: terminator 
Message: except (KeyError, ValueError), ex: 
Message: File "/usr/bin/terminator", line 123

Hopefully this will help fix the problem. Until then the app is unusable for me.
summary: Recently Stopped Working - Won't load on Ubuntu 18.04

description:
I have been using this terminal emulator for a while now and I would recommend it to any developer. The way I use it is to have the terminal split into 2 terminals and sometimes a 3rd below one of them. That way I can edit 2 files or edit 1 file and compile and check results on the other side. 

jumping left or right, or below or above, is a question of using alt-left, alt right etc. It helps me keeping oversight while editing multiple sources and sometimes also running or compiling.

Recommended!

Using Terminator daily. Shortcuts for splitting windows, black/white/red design and switching between panes are awesome.

The disadvantages is that layout doesn't save the location of directories for panes, and the project doesn't have active maintainers anymore https://bugs.launchpad.net/terminator/+bug/1849375
Anyone having issues where broadcast groups duplicate input? ex: typing "ll" in one pane will type "llll" in the others?
I tried tmux for a short while, but I like Terminator much more as it is way more intuitive and requires less setting up.
good, recommend
Works perfectly on ubuntu all flavors

Absolutely love this terminal! Being able to arrange my terminals into a grid so seamlessly is a huge productivity boost. I have yet to really dive into all of the features of Terminator but I'm quite happy with it. I deifnitely recommend everyone give it a shot.

Broken out of the box with Ubuntu 19.10 and version 1.91 due to how an environmental variable is set.

Some digging shows that the bug goes back to 2014, and is comes and goes with releases. Unacceptable.

Finally! A better way to run multiple console commands at once and be able to view them without having to either switch between tabs or have a choppy mess of aligning different application windows! Not to mention the customization is really nice!
So, so, good! Loads of customisation. Just the most useful app.
Looks sweet! Multi tasking all the way!
summary: Trying it now for the first time!

description: Think I first used this bundled with crunchbang and haven't used anything else since.
summary: Works well and easy to use

description: I have some minor problems splitting windows and other shortctus with on 20.04, but it still is vastly better than the default terminal. Also, hotkeys for some of my programs don't fully work with this terminal, forcing me to ocassionaly use alternatives. For example, I use "micro" as my editor, and many of its hotkeys don't work when run in terminator. All this aside, I really enjoy the productivity boost this brings.
summary: Can't do without, even with the bugs

description: Much easier to multitask than the default terminal.
Now they conviently snap together and can be customized! Only downside is that using "Mirror Keyboard" seems to duplicate every keystroke in the groupbut that's simply a feature quirk.
summary: Awesome! No more trying to allign terminals!

description: I really enjoy Terminator. I setup my preferences once, and share them between my various workstations. I especially enjoy the keyboard shortcuts.
I've been using it for many years, can't imagine working without it.

Apparently, there are 2 versions of Terminator in the Ubuntu App store. This one and 1.9.1. I still don't know what the other version (=1.9.1) is for (e.g. if it's scam or not), but at least it didn't work. So, please pay attention to the version you download. 

However, this version works perfectly fine on Ubuntu 20.04 and provides all the comfort I knew already from Ubuntu 16.04 where I have been using it for years. Just absolutely convenient to have multiple terminals in one window!
Aa above. Agagagaa because I can't post with so few letters
summary: Probably the best terminal there is

Terminator will never give you up
